snippet: Results at three other big steel makers have also been weak in a punishing economy. At U.S. Steel, net income was down by half from a year ago, but well up from a loss in the first quarter.
abstract: US Steel reports second-quarter earnings that exceed Wall Street's expectations, though net income still fell by half in the three months ending in June 2012 compared to the year-ago quarter; reports earnings of $101 million, or 62 cents a share, down 54.5 percent from net income of $222 million, or $1.33 a share, a year ago; revenue fell 2 percent to $5.02 billion.
lead_paragraph: Results at three other big steel makers have also been weak in a punishing economy. At U.S. Steel, net income was down by half from a year ago, but well up from a loss in the first quarter.

headline.main: U.S. Steel Beats Forecasts in a Tough Climate
headline.print_headline: U.S. Steel Beats Forecasts in a Tough Climate
